attributes.action: amend the proposed legislation for the mandatory fortification of flour with folic acid
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We, the undersigned, respectfully request that the Food Standards Agency

incorporate an opt-out clause for traditional wind and watermills into
any legislation requiring the mandatory fortification of flour with
folic acid.

While not opposed to the general principle of fortification we, the undersigned, believe that traditional wind and water mills must be allowed to opt out of these proposals. Most will not be able to afford the devastating cost of buying and installing the equipment needed to meet the new requirements,nor, in some cases, be permitted to install such equipment due to the listing of these historic buildings or have the space required within the confines of the mill. 

The proposed legislation (as drafted) may cause many working historic wind and water mills to cease production, sounding the death-knell for a
practice that has been part of the country’s life since Roman times. 

It is ironic that at a time when so much of the national agenda is focused on the production of natural, local produce, our traditional,historic mills are threatened by legislation that may force them to close.
